00115 /* Pantheios core API relies on STLSoft for compiler/library discrimination,

00117  */

00136 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00137  * Feature detection
00138  */
00139 
00140 /* By default, Pantheios is a multi-byte string library
00141  *
00142  * If you define \c PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS, then it will be built in
00143  * wide string form.
00144  *
00145  * Also, if you are compiling for Windows (32-bit or 64-bit) and define
00146  * either \c _UNICODE or \c UNICODE, then \c PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS will
00147  * be defined automatically.
00148  *
00149  * In either case, if you define \c PANTHEIOS_NO_USE_WIDE_STRINGS, then the
00150  * wide string support will be suppressed.
00151  */
00152 
00153 #ifndef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00154 # if defined(_WIN32) && \
00155      defined(UNICODE) && \
00156      defined(_UNICODE)
00157 #  define PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00158 # endif /* _WIN32 && UNICODE && _UNICODE */
00159 #endif /* !PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00160 
00161 #ifdef PANTHEIOS_NO_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00162 # ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00163 #  undef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00164 # endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00165 #endif /* PANTHEIOS_NO_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00166 
00167 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00168  * Includes - 2
00169  */
00170 
00171 #ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00172 # ifndef _WCHAR_T_DEFINED
00173 #  include <wchar.h>    /* for wchar_t (if not built-in) */
00174 # endif /* !_WCHAR_T_DEFINED */
00175 #endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00176 
00177 #include <pantheios/internal/string_encoding.h>
00178

00210                                                         \
00211     (((sev) & 0x0f) | (((xi28) << 4) & ~0x0f))

00291 #if defined(STLSOFT_COMPILER_IS_MSVC) && \
00292     (   _MSC_VER >= 1500 || \

00296 #define PANTHEIOS_DECLARE_DEPRECATION(symtype, oldfn, newfn)    __declspec(deprecated("The " symtype " " PANTHEIOS_STRINGIZE(oldfn) " is deprecated and will be removed from a future version of Pantheios; use " PANTHEIOS_STRINGIZE(newfn) " instead"))
00297 #define PANTHEIOS_CALL_DEPRECATED(rt, oldfn, newfn)             PANTHEIOS_DECLARE_DEPRECATION("function", oldfn, newfn) PANTHEIOS_DECLSPEC PANTHEIOS_EXTERN_C rt PANTHEIOS_CALLCONV
00298 #else /* ? compiler */
00299 #define PANTHEIOS_DECLARE_DEPRECATION(symtype, oldfn, newfn)
00300 #define PANTHEIOS_CALL_DEPRECATED(rt, oldfn, newfn)             PANTHEIOS_CALL(rt)
00301 #endif /* compiler */

01347 #if !defined(PANTHEIOS_DOCUMENTATION_SKIP_SECTION) && \
01348     defined(STLSOFT_COMPILER_IS_GCC) /* TODO: Change this to proper discriminated feature */
01349 int logprintf(
01350     pan_sev_t           severity
01351 ,   pan_char_t const*   format
01352 ,   ...
01353 )
01354 __attribute__((format(printf,2,3)))
01355 ;
01356 #endif /* compiler */
01357 
01358 inline int logprintf(
01359     pan_sev_t           severity
01360 ,   pan_char_t const*   format
01361 ,   ...
01362 )
01363 {
01364     va_list args;
01365     int     ret;
01366 
01367     va_start(args, format);
01368 
01369     ret = pantheios_logvprintf(severity, format, args);
01370 
01371     va_end(args);
01372 
01373     return ret;
01374 }
01375 
01376 
01381 inline int logvprintf(
01382     pan_sev_t           severity
01383 ,   pan_char_t const*   format
01384 ,   va_list             args
01385 )
01386 {
01387     return pantheios_logvprintf(severity, format, args);
01388 }

01404 # ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
01405 inline wchar_t const* c_str_ptr_w(pan_slice_t const& s)
01406 {
01407     return (0 == s.len) ? L"" : s.ptr;
01408 }
01409 # else /* ? PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01410 inline char const* c_str_ptr_a(pan_slice_t const& s)
01411 {
01412     return (0 == s.len) ? "" : s.ptr;
01413 }
01414 # endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01415 
01416 inline pan_char_t const* c_str_ptr(pan_slice_t const& s)
01417 {
01418 # ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
01419     return c_str_ptr_w(s);
01420 # else /* ? PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01421     return c_str_ptr_a(s);
01422 # endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01423 }
01424 
01426 # ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
01427 inline wchar_t const* c_str_ptr_null_w(pan_slice_t const& s)
01428 {
01429     return (0 != s.len) ? s.ptr : NULL;
01430 }
01431 # else /* ? PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01432 inline char const* c_str_ptr_null_a(pan_slice_t const& s)
01433 {
01434     return (0 != s.len) ? s.ptr : NULL;
01435 }
01436 # endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01437 
01438 inline pan_char_t const* c_str_ptr_null(pan_slice_t const& s)
01439 {
01440 # ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
01441     return c_str_ptr_null_w(s);
01442 # else /* ? PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01443     return c_str_ptr_null_a(s);
01444 # endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01445 }
01446 
01448 # ifdef PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
01449 inline wchar_t const* c_str_data_w(pan_slice_t const& s)
01450 {
01451     return c_str_ptr(s);
01452 }
01453 # else /* ? PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01454 inline char const* c_str_data_a(pan_slice_t const& s)
01455 {
01456     return c_str_ptr(s);
01457 }
01458 # endif /* PANTHEIOS_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
01459

01465     return c_str_data_a(s);

01669 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01670  * Namespace
01671  */
01672 
01673 #ifdef __cplusplus
01674 # ifndef PANTHEIOS_DOCUMENTATION_SKIP_SECTION
01675 inline /* static */ size_t pan_slice_t::calc_length_n_(pan_char_t const* s, size_t len)
01676 {
01677 #if !defined(PANTHEIOS_NO_NAMESPACE)
01678     return pantheios::util::strnlen(s, len);
01679 #else /* ? !PANTHEIOS_NO_NAMESPACE */
01680     return pantheios_util_strnlen(s, len);
01681 #endif /* !PANTHEIOS_NO_NAMESPACE */
01682 }
01683 
01684 inline pan_slice_t::pan_slice_t()
01685     : len(0)
01686     , ptr(NULL)
01687 {}
01688 inline pan_slice_t::pan_slice_t(pan_char_t const* p, size_t l)
01689     : len(l)
01690     , ptr(p)
01691 {
01692     const size_t topBit = size_t(0x01) << (sizeof(size_t) * 8 - 1);
01693 
01694     if(topBit & len)
01695     {
01696         this->len = calc_length_n_(p, len);
01697     }
01698 }
01699 inline pan_slice_t::pan_slice_t(pan_slice_t const& rhs)
01700     : len(rhs.len)
01701     , ptr(rhs.ptr)
01702 {}
01703 inline pan_slice_t& pan_slice_t::operator =(pan_slice_t const& rhs)
01704 {
01705     len = rhs.len;
01706     ptr = rhs.ptr;
01707 
01708     return *this;
01709 }
01710 
01711 inline pan_slice_t::pan_slice_t(int l, pan_char_t const* p)
01712     : len(calc_length_n_(p, static_cast<size_t>(l)))
01713     , ptr(p)
01714 {}
01715 # endif /* !PANTHEIOS_DOCUMENTATION_SKIP_SECTION */
01716 #endif /* __cplusplus */
01717 
01718 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01719  * Namespace
01720  */
01721 
01722 #if !defined(PANTHEIOS_NO_NAMESPACE)
01723 } /* namespace pantheios */
01724 
01725 
01726 # ifndef PANTHEIOS_NO_STOCK_LEVELS
01727 
01728 /* #define the severity levels at the global level, since the construction
01729  * of pantheios::PANTHEIOS_SEV_xxx is too wordy and unnecessary.
01730  */
01731 
01772 #  define PANTHEIOS_SEV_EMERGENCY       ::pantheios::SEV_EMERGENCY
01773 #  define PANTHEIOS_SEV_ALERT           ::pantheios::SEV_ALERT
01774 #  define PANTHEIOS_SEV_CRITICAL        ::pantheios::SEV_CRITICAL
01775 #  define PANTHEIOS_SEV_ERROR           ::pantheios::SEV_ERROR
01776 #  define PANTHEIOS_SEV_WARNING         ::pantheios::SEV_WARNING
01777 #  define PANTHEIOS_SEV_NOTICE          ::pantheios::SEV_NOTICE
